A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Star Wars fans give Star Wars fans a bad name. Here we have what is hands down the best film in the series since Empire\, nearly 40 years ago\, and we have fans that have the audacity to trash it. The Force Awakens was too derivative and the prequels were too all around terrible (I agree)\, but where's the point of placation for the broader fandom if not here?

There were so many moments that filled me with wonder and scenes I've wanted for years (blowing the command center that she's stood behind for decades\, literally forced Leia into a role she should've taken years ago). As a director\, Johnson's storytelling flourishes are genius\, while Yedlin fills the film with frame-worthy after frame-worthy shot. The Last Jedi was simultaneously nostalgic and fresh\, a Star Wars film I didn't I wanted\, but am so happy to finally have seen. 

Bugger the naysayers\, this is a exceptional filmmaking.
